data.title: Hanns Eisler & Ernst Busch
data.text:
tinear

Hello Erich (& also thanks to Makropoulos).

I deleted an earlier post under my main ID (there's this GIT going-

around instantly 'one-starring' virtually all the posts - gave me the

hump!) which was rather more of a commentary - and I mentioned that

(whilst there are Berlin Classics CDs) the 45 EPs had that

documentation - also, I made this 'part one' hoping (but not

expecting..) there might be some interest shown.

I know this is a 'lop-sided' view of Eisler - but, selectively,

there's much to enjoy...not everything is Proletarian Bravado..

I've two mint mono Eterna LPs - 8 10 017 (Eisler Legenden, Lieder und

Balladen 1914-1934) + 019 (Eisler/Tucholsky)..also quite a few more of

those 'Lied der Zeit' 78s - not all devoted to Eisler (+ some early'

70s stereo Eisler - Songs/Chamber & Piano).

There's also a 2LP (8 10 015-16) '100 Jahre Deutches Arbeiter lied' -

(a documentary) where, from memory, I should be able to extract some

material.

On top of that, although not predominantly 'classical', I've a

'substantial' quantity of the rare early WMA/Topic 10" 78s - which I

want to upload for documentary perposes - when I have a stable server

(Ie not deleting files after 30days inactivity) - and BroadBand.

There's a Topic discography @ http://www.mustrad.org.uk/discos/discog.htm

- which I added some details to - as titles can be elusive..

Incidentally, the other side to the (wonderful) 1935 'Daily Worker

Choir' Eisler is a 'Plea for Unity' by the Communist MP W. Gallagher -

this is a rare disc indeed.

All best

frankwm

Post by EM

Thanks, but I keep getting "Sorry, the free service is at full

capacity" from sendspace.com.

EM

*************

Just about to GTB..

Uploads are taking place - but if /*/anyone/*/ who already has them

would copy them to mediafire/etc (which, using DU I can't manage -

incredibly slow-speeds - that's why I use Sendspace..) then give me

the titles/links & I'll either add them to the blog - or put them on

the googlegroups site with a link to the blog - my email is accesible

from google rmcr.

After a gap I'll do an upload of the remainder (or most of..)...&

thank God not all the stuff is 'rowdy'!

Any more 'old' Eisler - or similar..?? - then why not join my 'dead'

googlegroup http://groups.google.com/group/themusicparlour and add

file-details to the existing thread..

Not really looking for it to be a 'conversation' site - but I'll put a

'permanent' blog-link to there if anyone is interested...
